589215aa-d7dc-455e-b277-86ebe1da26aa.content: PyParticles analysis: CPU physics uses Numba kernels + uniform grid cell list; interaction rules layered (linear/inv-square/inv-cube/repel), wave mechanics with torque; biology adds energy/metabolism/mitosis; data layout is SoA (pos/vel/energy/etc) with active count; OpenGL renderer via ModernGL instanced points + shader pipeline; UI uses pygame_gui with live matrix editor and parameter sliders. Key lessons for Gene Particles: adopt grid neighbor path + Numba kernels, multi-layer force rules, GPU/GL renderer, richer live UI, and species-level parameter packs; consider long-range methods (Barnes–Hut/FMM), Verlet lists, spatial hashing, SPH/PBD, and DOD/SoA layouts for scalability.

352be2fb-5479-41f7-9522-e15a2b5847e4.content: Added Algorithms Lab to game_forge: new package `game_forge/src/algorithms_lab` with Domain/WrapMode core, Morton encoding, UniformGrid spatial hash, Verlet NeighborList, Barnes–Hut tree, simplified 2D FMM, SPH and PBF solvers, and metrics/direct N-body reference. Added demos/benchmarks/profiler scripts under `game_forge/tools/algorithms_lab`, docs and references under `game_forge/algorithms_lab/`, and tests for each module. Bench (256 particles, 20 steps) ran: grid ~0.20s, neighbor-list ~0.01s, barnes-hut ~5.57s, fmm2d ~0.30s, sph ~0.20s, pbf ~0.21s; profiler output saved to /tmp/algorithms_lab.prof.

5c3cb793-2295-48ac-be27-a7c6b7ee4b24.content: Performance-focused refinements in algorithms_lab: Domain now caches sizes/inv_sizes and uses them in minimal-image wrapping; SPH and PBF use np.bincount for scalar/vector accumulation to reduce add.at overhead; added PERFORMANCE.md with tuning/accelerator guidance and updated docs README. Commit: f14a960fcc.
